column5: Being that I might leave my hut out on the ice, overnight this coming week; I went on-line and registered the hut with the MNR. I know about placing the numbers on the hut; but should I keep a copy of the registration confirmation in the hut? It has all my contact info on it and it would be proof that I didn't just make up the numbers? What do you people think? I would get the conformation letter laminated, if the consensus was to have it with me.  Dan.
on simcoe i only had numbers on the hut, never any other paperwork at one time i had 2 huts out both used the same number never been asked for proof of numbers or ownership

Yeah, you only need one number for any number of huts. I have used the same number for like 25yrs on several different huts. Right now I have the number on two huts....but neither are on the ice LOL....go figure!  I wouldn't worry about it. As long as there is a number on it you won't have a problem.  S.
Just take a pic of your info.  Same with my licence, I always carry my wallet but have pic on my phone.
Thanks The less paper, the less I have to loose or wonder where I safely put it away.  Dan.
Yah I do that all the time, put stuff in a safe place so I know where it is.  Then I spend 4 hours looking for that safe place!  LOL!
Yah I do that all the time, put stuff in a safe place so I know where it is.  Then I spend 4 hours looking for that safe place!  LOL! At least you know that it is in a really, really safe place.
Yah I do that all the time, put stuff in a safe place so I know where it is.  Then I spend 4 hours looking for that safe place!  LOL! Funny how you always find it in the last place you look . . .
